title: Ethiopia: Ethiopia, World Bank Sign Two Loan Agreements
text:
Ethiopia, World Bank Sign Two Loan Agreements Tagged: Kenya: Jubilee Parties to Merge in December Ethiopia and the World Bank have signed two loan agreements worth 5.1 million and 600 million dollars. The agreements were signed by State Minister for Finance and Economic Cooperation, Ahmed Shide, and WB Acting Country Director for Ethiopia, Qaisar Khan. The 600 million dollar loan will be used to enhance equitable access to basic services in education, health, agriculture, water supply, sanitation and rural roads in weredas. It will also help to boost accountability through the Enhancing Shared Prosperity through Equitable Services programme to be implemented by MoFEC. The programmeis for the entire country except for the capital Addis Abeba. The 5.1 million dollar project is for the Tana and Beles Integrated Water Resources Development Project, which is currently underfinanced. Ethiopia
